definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: To protect birds and wild animal.
sentences.chinese: 保護鳥類保護野生動物人人有責。

sentences.english: If a man breaks the law, it is everyone's duty to hand him over to justice.
sentences.chinese: 假如有人犯了法，人人有責把他送交法庭審判。

sentences.english: The same sky, harmony, animal protection, responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 同一個藍天下，和諧相處，保護動物，人人有責。

sentences.english: Remember, the company is everyone's responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 記住，公司的事人人有責。

sentences.english: Nobody in the room, lock the door behind one, prevent the thief, the duty of everyone.
sentences.chinese: 室內無人，隨手關門，防止竊賊，人人有責。

sentences.english: It is everyone's to make our school smoking-free environment.
sentences.chinese: 人人有責使學校成爲無煙場所。

sentences.english: Every one is responsible to protect forest.
Leaders should pay much attention to school-running cost control and everyone be responsible for it.
sentences.chinese: 辦學成本控制應該領導重視，人人有責。

sentences.english: Everybody is responsible for environmental protection.
Protecting the environment is our duty.
sentences.chinese: 意思就是保護環境人人有責。

definition: to offer advice/to make a suggestion
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
magic mirror for revealing goblins/fig. way of seeing through a conspiracy
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
